title: How to Make Fried Parsley

steps.headline: Wash the parsley and let it dry thoroughly.
steps.description: There must be absolutely no moisture on the parsley before adding it to the hot oil. If there is any water on the parsley, it will splutter violently.

steps.headline: Heat the oil until it is extremely hot in a suitable frying container.
Place the dry parsley in a frying basket.
Lower the basket carefully into the hot oil.
steps.description: Expect it to hiss dramatically. When the hissing stops, raise the basket out.

steps.headline: Place the fried parsley on paper towels.
steps.description: This will drain the excess oil.

steps.headline: Add to the side of a meal as a garnish.
steps.description: Serve immediately because the crispness lasts only for a few minutes.

text: Wash the parsley and let it dry thoroughly. There must be absolutely no moisture on the parsley before adding it to the hot oil. If there is any water on the parsley, it will splutter violently. Heat the oil until it is extremely hot in a suitable frying container.  Place the dry parsley in a frying basket.  Lower the basket carefully into the hot oil. Expect it to hiss dramatically. When the hissing stops, raise the basket out. Place the fried parsley on paper towels. This will drain the excess oil. Add to the side of a meal as a garnish. Serve immediately because the crispness lasts only for a few minutes.
